website_summaries.verdict: Uses only the highest quality materials to ensure compatibility with all federal emissions requirements.
pros: Works as advertised to help maintain Selective Catalytic Reduction diesel engines
Contains all of the certifications required for a product like this
Nicely designed container means you don't have to worry about leaks
cons: A little more expensive than some other DEF products in this bottle size

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty much the cheapest decent DEF fluid you can buy
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the cheapest decent DEF fluid you can buy. Just learned you can fill up your DEF tank at truck stops for $2/gallon, so I'll be doing that in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Bought Nov 2016 and got old DEF
customer_reviews.text: Bought Nov 2016, and my expectation is that I will get new DEF. Instead it's dated Feb 2015, so is almost two years old. Somebody's dumping old DEF on Amazon customers, so buyer beware! Thought I'd save some money, but the risk does not outweigh the reward.
customer_reviews.author: therealbigsky

customer_reviews.title: I like to save some money
customer_reviews.text: Caused a P207f code (contaminated DEF) in my 2015 Ram Cummins. Thankfully I was able to just clear the code and keep on trucking, but it sure caused a little heartburn when I started to read about the cost of draining my DEF tank. I like to save some money, but the savings wouldn't have justified the cost to fix this if clearing the code didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: spoon059

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and I bought it frequently for use in our business, despite the long wait for delivery in some instances. Ever since the hurricane hit Texas the price on this brand in particular has skyrocketed and I have had to go back to purchasing at local auto repair stores. My guys have no complaints about this. We run Ford 250s & 350s and some of our equipment requires DEF as well. Will resume purchasing when the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This product is working as expected. I haven't experienced any negative results from this product and it's a good price for a name brand DEF fluid. I will purchase this again as long as the price stays competitive.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: Using this stuff in a 2016 Chevy Colorado Diesel, and it's been working good. Seems to get the job done just fine! I absolutely love the spouts that come with the cans, makes filling an absolute breeze because there's nothing else needed other than what comes in the box!
customer_reviews.author: Leighton Markus

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is (or was) much less expensive than other brands. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A little expensive
customer_reviews.text: It is DEF, nothing outstanding about it. However, it is WAY more expensive than filling up at the pump.
customer_reviews.author: GRUNT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price, does what it is supposed to do with my diesel VW
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Crook

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine in my 2017 GMC Denali HD. No problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Rivers55

customer_reviews.title: working great for 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee Diesel.
customer_reviews.text: used it on my 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee Diesel. working fine, no issues or warnings.
customer_reviews.author: Shimshen

customer_reviews.title: DEF fluid, in my opinion, is a necessary ...
customer_reviews.text: DEF fluid, in my opinion, is a necessary evil. You have to have it in order to turn off the warning lights on the dash. So I try to buy it at the lowest price that I can find. This DEF fluid was cheaper than my local auto parts stores and way cheaper than the dealer.
customer_reviews.author: speycast4steelhead

customer_reviews.title: No issues with EcoDiesel
customer_reviews.text: My 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokee EcoDiesel is having issue with this product. The included pour spout is a nice touch, but will leak a bit until air starts moving so have a rag in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jomb

customer_reviews.title: The specifications are same for ADBLUE used in Mercedes Benz ...
customer_reviews.text: The specifications are same for ADBLUE used in Mercedes Benz vehicles,price of product inline with other diesel DEF manufacturers .
customer_reviews.author: R. Foyder

customer_reviews.title: Works great and on most newer diesel trucks it's a requirement
customer_reviews.text: Works great and on most newer diesel trucks it's a requirement. So it's great being able to just have it delivered right to your front door.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Bargiacchi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for these DEF refills. No reason to pay more for the same stuff.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyM

customer_reviews.title: Ordered pack of 6 but only received 5
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 6 pack but only received 5. How does this happen?
customer_reviews.author: Joe Childs

customer_reviews.title: cheaper elsewere
customer_reviews.text: I have to have it but it's much too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Christine Chesson

customer_reviews.title: But works great in my
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on using a none mopar product in my 2104 Diesel Jeep grand Cherokee, But works great in my Jeep
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item but only received 5 gallons not the 6 as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This taste great over ice with a dash of lemon juice.
customer_reviews.author: oh

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: It advertised as a two pack but was a single
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good price, arrived on time, will order more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lacy

product_meta.title: Prestone HD1001-2PK Command Diesel Exhaust Fluid - 2.5 Gallon, (Pack of 2)
product_meta.description:
Size:Pack of 2| Style:2.5 GallonPrestone Command DEF is formulated with high quality urea and demineralized water to work with ALL SCR-equipped diesel engines. Prestone Command DEF is a safe, easy-to-handle nontoxic solution of 67.5% water and 32.5% automotive grade urea. It is a stable fluid that is colorless and odorless. Diesel Exhaust Fluid (DEF) is a consumable and essential fluid for maintaining Selective Catalytic Reduction (SCR)-equipped modern diesel engines. SCR allows the engine manufacturer to tune the engine for increased fuel efficiency while remaining in compliance with Federal emissions requirements.

Prestone Command DEF usage will vary by vehicle. Most OEMs estimate usage will be 2-3% of diesel fuel consumption. On average, this amounts to one gallon of DEF to every 50-75 gallons of fuel. Check owner’s manual for proper usage in your vehicle. DEF reacts with certain metals such as aluminum, copper, and brass. Therefore, only place DEF in storage tanks and dispensing equipment made of stainless steel or high density polyethylene.
feature_bullets: Formulated to work with all SCR-equipped diesel engines
Safe, easy-to-handle, nontoxic solution of 67.5% water and 32.5% automotive grade urea
Certified to meet all API & ISO 22241 requirements
Compatible with AdBlue and other DEF products
DEF is a consumable and essential fluid for maintaining SCR-equipped modern diesel engines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars54 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
